newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lufthansa says protest to cost 20 mln dmk.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa says protest to cost 20 mln dmk.

text.p: German airline Deutsche Lufthansa AG said on Thursday that a two-hour union work stoppage by disgruntled workers upset with a long-running pay dispute would cost it around 20 million marks ($13 million).

Lufthansa said in a statement that 49 European flights planned for the two-hour period during the walkout from 0530 GMT to 0730 GMT were cancelled out of a scheduled 87 flights but that intercontinental flights were not affected. ($ = 1.543 German Marks)
Lufthansa says protest to cost 20 million =2
The airline said earlier on Thursday that a total of 92 flights during the day would be cancelled due to the work stoppage and would affect about 6,500 passengers.
The airline said its afternoon flight schedule had been normalised to a large extent after the work stoppage by flight staff and technical workers who are members of the DAG white-collar union.
The union has demanded that Lufthansa shorten the duration of its current contract offer at 27 months and offer a higher wage increase than the existing offer of 1.7 percent.

Lufthansa has already signed a contract with the same terms it is offering to the DAG with the OeTV public-sector workers' union, which represents blue-collar workers and ground personnel at the airline, which has more than 50,000 workers.
